intro: Elaeocarpus gaoligongshanensis, commonly known as the Gaoligongshan elaeocarpus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province, China. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within subtropical forests, where it thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a striking combination of white and pink hues, while its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
